notesStmt.note: Much stained. One leaf lost after folio 29.

Avraham Asher ibn Yitsḥaḳ London: inscribed in a note, Sivan [5]605 [1845]: folio 3r.Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active 1585-1624): inscribed with his name (folio 278v); see 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1618 (folio 287v); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84. Several birth entries, inscribed on the flyleaves: Colomba daughter of Shemu᾿el and Juditta Ravenna, 17 Iyar 1680 (folio 2r); Bila Viola, daughter of the same parents, 9 Siṿan 1682 (folio 2r); Shemu᾿el Barukh, son of Rivkah, daughter of Eli῾ezer of Cologna, 29 Marheshvan 1644 (folio 279r); Yosef David, son of the same parents, 22 Kisleṿ 1646; Mordekhai , son of the same parents, 12 Adar 1657 (folio 279r); Riḳah, daughter of Immanuel Pinto and Juditta, 15 Elul 1672 (folio 279r); a son of the same parents, 9 Siṿan 1674 (folio 279v); Avraham, 2 Tamuz 1676 (folio 280r); Barukh Mordekhai, son of Yosef Ravenna and Tamar, 13 Iyar 1683 (folio 281r); Cremesina, daughter of the same parents, 23 Sivan 1685 (folio 281r); Shemu᾿el, son of the same parents, 11 Kisleṿ 1688 (folio 281r); Diamanta, daughter of the same parents, 2 Siṿan [....] (folio 281v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 28 quires of originally10 leaves each (folios 3-281), marked with catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square and semi-cursive script of the 15th century. Punctuated.

binding.p: Post-1600. Red leather. Boxed. Spine: 'Machazor. Secund Ritum. Romanum. Hebr. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 19,666.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, [282v].
